intro: Senecio changii, commonly known as the Chang's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers a sunny to partially shaded environment. Senecio changii has narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in a cluster. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
